greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: An infinite juggling sequence of three balls: successively larger 'prime' ground-state 3-ball site swaps listed in lexicographical order. A subset of A084511.
comment: A juggling sequence is defined as 'prime', if it does not visit any state more than once. This means that in A084523 no integer occurs twice between consecutive sevens.
link: A. Karttunen, Scheme-program for computing this sequence
Index entries for sequences related to juggling
xref: The number of such site swaps of length n is given by A084529. First position where n appears: A084527.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 02 2003
